text: Bilal Abbas Khan () is a Pakistani actor. Khan made his acting debut with a role of Afaq in Saya-Deewar Bhi Nahi. He has played the role of Qasim in Hum TV drama O Rangreza. He further appeared in ARY Digital's Balaa for which he won Social Media Award for best actor & received nomination for Best TV Actor at Lux Style Award.his 2019 play Cheekh is also grabbing audiences applaud in his negative acting "Fans choose Bilal Abbas Khan as the best actor of 2018" (12 February 2019), Daily Times. Retrieved 14 February 2019. He later appeared as Wajih Taseer in crime drama Cheekh and appeared as Navy Officer Behram in Geo Entertainment's telefilm Laal. ==Life and career== Khan was born on 4 June 1993 in Karachi, where he was also raised and received his early education but later on was sent to a boarding school, Lawrence School, in Murree. He later joined SZABIST, Karachi, to study marketing.Mahwash Ajaz (20 November 2017), "I would love to essay Ranveer Singh’s avatar in ‘Padmavati’: Bilal Abbas Khan", The Express Tribune. Retrieved 9 January 2018. His father served as DSP Karachi and his mother is a fashion designer, while he has two brothers and a sister.Farwa (11 October 2018), "Here Are 7 Surprising Facts About Bilal Abbas Khan That You SHOULD Know!", Parhlo. Retrieved 12 March 2020. Having formally studied acting at the NAPA and being mainly inspired by Viola Spolin's "great focus on improvisation and improvisational techniques",Ally Adnan (24 September 2018), "I want people to remember me for my work: Bilal Abbas Khan", Daily Times. Retrieved 9 January 2019. he started acting in 2016 and has since then appeared in many Pakistani television serials. ==Filmography== ===Television=== {| class="wikitable" |- !
